fields.description:
After upgrading Confluence to 3.4.* with MySQL, Confluence fails to correctly update the NOTIFICATIONS table. The result is that the table is missing 3 columns: DIGEST, CONTENTTYPE and NETWORK. This behavior is related to [CONF-20318|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-20318].

The logs shows the following:
{code}ERROR [http-8888-4] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- referer: http://wiki.biogenidec.com/spaces/removespace.action?key=REGALP | url: /spaces/doremovespace.action | userName: hayesw
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateSystemException: exception setting property value with CGLIB (set hibernate.cglib.use_reflection_optimizer=false for more info) setter of com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.Notification.setDigest; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.PropertyAccessException: exception setting property value with CGLIB (set hibernate.cglib.use_reflection_optimizer=false for more info) setter of com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.Notification.setDigest
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.PropertyAccessException: exception setting property value with CGLIB (set hibernate.cglib.use_reflection_optimizer=false for more info) setter of com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.Notification.setDigest{code}

This behavior has been experienced with MySQL 5.0 and 5.1.
fields.summary: NOTIFICATIONS table loses columns in MySql after upgrade in 3.4.*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21794].
  {panel}

Friendly dates are dates displayed like 'yesterday, 3 hours ago, two days ago...'
The methods come from
getFriendlyDate() - Method in class com.atlassian.confluence.userstatus.actions.UserStatusJsonResult
getFriendlyDateFormatter() - Method in class com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport 
In some places such as page comments, there is also a tooltip giving the exact timestamp (date + time)
In other places, such as the history of the navigation (a good old popup), this is not the case.

The problems are that:
- there is no visual way to distinguish if '3 hours ago' is before '3 hours ago' for another comment because this is a 'rounded' time. You need to look at the tooltips and tooltips are not present everywhere
- when you print you get also the friendly dates
- our QA DON'T want friendly dates. It goes against our governmental standard of using ISO dates.
- I had a look at the source code that we have and there is 
- I use a custom theme and there is no way to replace the FriendlyDateFormatter injected in the actions (through a factory, setting, no setter and private field) (so I need to bypass the private protection if I want to do it, doing this in each overriden vmd file...)

I can change the date and time format in the administration panel for the general configuration for date, time, date+time...
There is nothing equivalent for the friendly date.

I suggest to add a setting in the administration with a selection list for the friendly date
- default behavior (current one, default setting)
- display the Date Time Format (using the format defined upper)
- display the Date Format (using the format defined upper)

The expected result should be that all the friendly dates (normal pages, popups...) will use this setting.
fields.summary: Provide a way to turn off globally "friendly dates" or to use an alternate format

fields.description:
The user docs for confluence 3.4 indicate that users should use the "Web Link" option for adding links to new pages:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+and+Removing+Links+in+the+Rich+Text+Editor#AddingandRemovingLinksintheRichTextEditor-LinkingtoaNonExistentConfluencePage

This is completely counter-intuitive, as links to new pages would never be web links, especially as the url hints "http://" by default.

I've been using confluence since v.1.4, and this is one of the first times I've been completely stumped (obviously I know how to do this in the wikitext editor).

I suggest either:
a) adding a "Create 'New Page' link to: <page name user typed in> in the auto-suggest drop-down list, perhaps above the entry for "Search for '<page name user typed i>'" (probably the preferable option), or
b) adding a "New Page Link" option on the left of the link editor
fields.summary: Using "Web Link" to add a link to a new page confusing and counterintuitive

fields.description:
After upgrading to Confluence 3.4, the Rich Text Editor breaks standard keyboard functionality.

*How:* By capturing {{AltGr + \[1 - 7, Q\]}} (which produce different special characters on European keyboard layouts) as {{Ctrl + Alt + \[1 - 7, Q\]}} (which formats text as heading, quote or paragraph). 

Below are examples of only a few signs that cannot be produced due to this bug. They may apply to more than one layout and many more can be found for instance on [Wikipedia|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keyboard_layout#QWERTY].

Examples:
AltGr + 2 produces at sign {{(@)}} (FI)
AltGr + 3 produces pound sign {{(£)}} (FI)
AltGr + 4 produces dollar sign {{($)}} (FI)
AltGr + 7 produces left curly brace {{(\{)}} (FI)
AltGr + Q produces at sign {{(@)}} (IS, DE)

This behavior is changed from Confluence 3.3 where Ctrl + Alt + number combinations were not mapped to heading formatting shortcuts; only Ctrl + number combinations were.

To reproduce one of these issues:
- Change the keyboard layout to Finnish
- Open the Rich Text Editor
- Type some text
- Press AltGr+2, which should produce an at sign {{(@)}}

Instead the text changes to a level 2 heading.

This behavior is breaking our editing experience as the only way to produce these special characters is to switch to markup mode. This breaks the editing workflow. The bug is also not readily apparent and may confuse a large portion of users.

{panel:title=Workaround|bgColor=#aaccff}NOTE: A workaround has been provided in the comments by Atlassian ([link|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-21780?focusedCommentId=228496&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-228496]), although it has to be reapplied after every Confluence upgrade.{panel}
fields.summary: Updated: Cannot produce special characters using AltGr due to RTE keyboard shortcuts

fields.description:
We (our company) really love the fact how straight forward confluence is. Especially our technically not so well versed users. So, it is a great thing you can also search for multiple labels without modifying the URL or working with advanced search querys like "labelText:[label1] and .. and labelText:[label_n]".
Unfortunately this isn't obvious at all.

Here's an example (please also have a look at the picture):
Let's say I'm on a page in the space documenting the tools used in our company. There I see a "confluence" label and I'd like to get a list of all user tips concerning confluence.
So i click on the "confluence" label (1.)
Now I'm redirected to the next page (2.). At the top you know see "Label: confluence". Well, this makes sense. I clicked on the "confluence" label so I expected to be redirected to this page. But I also wanted to narrow the search down to tips (or "tipps" in German).
Sure I can see "tipps" listed in the "related labels" column. But since I got to "Label: confluence" by clicking on "confluence" just a few seconds ago, I naturally assume I will get to "Label: tipps" by clicking on "tipps". And that this page would list tips for every tool documented. Because that isn't what I want, I won't click it and there really is no hint at all that clicking "tipps" would exactly achieve what I want and works different than on the page before in the way that it further narrows down the search and doesn't just list all entries with a "tipps" label.

If I click on "tipps" anyway I get the "Label:confluence+tipps" page (3.) and that's great and all I wanted since the beginning but I honestly see no way to get to this conclusion other than just trying/guessing.

I'm sorry If my text may be a bit confusing but I hope you'll understand what I'm trying to say and agree with me in that this behavior should be made more clear. Perhapes with a hint like "To narrow the search further down you may click on one of the following labels: ...".
Or just implement check boxes like suggestet in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4577
fields.summary: More intuitive search for multiple lables via clicking

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the action links of Confluence's attachments lists. All versions from 2.7 to 3.4.7 are affected.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:

* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/MgCzDQ

The page also includes detailed patch instructions.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in the action links of Confluence's attachments lists.

fields.description:
Raised this on behalf of [CSP-56866|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-56866]
{quote}
In our opinion, this could be solved with some kind of "ticket" mechanism that overrules normal access rights.
We often have projects that are confidential by nature.
In a part of the project space, we store amongst other stuff meeting minutes.
Different types of meetings exist:
* Some types of meetings are confidential
* Some can be made available to a bigger group of people
* Some could even be made public.

Our previous publishing mechanism (Xythos, a document management system) allowed us to provide tickets to people.
Such tickets then allowed access to specific content disregarding the normal access rights.
Tickets could be read/only, read/write, time limited, password protected, linked to certain users/groups, etc.

Suppose you as a user have no access to space A.
If you possess a ticket for a certain page B below space A, you could immediately see space A.
The only content accessible in space A would in that case be the content for which you retrieved a ticket.
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve Page Restriction management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21761].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test Space and Page as the following hierarchy
#* Space
#** Home
#*** A
#**** A1
#***** A11
#***** A12
#**** A2
#*** B
# Assign a View Page restriction to *Home*. So all the child pages will inherit the View page restriction.
# Delete Page *A*
# Notice that child pages of *A* will become orphaned and will no more have the inherited View page restriction:
#* Space
#** A1
#*** A11
#*** A12
#** A2
#** Home
#*** B

h5. Workaround
Move the child pages back to their parent, as for the example above, to be under *Home*. So they will inherit the same View Page restriction again.
fields.summary: View page restriction of a child page will be lost once the parent page is removed

By default the outbound emails from confluence include the non-standard header Precedence.

http://linux.gids.nl/tls/draft-klyne-hdrreg-mail-00.html#hdr.Precedence

This is blocking me from using Amazon SES as my mail relay because it is not a supported header.
https://forums.aws.amazon.com/thread.jspa?messageID=220608&#220608

Other Atlassian products like Jira and Bamboo have support to turn this header on and off (see BAM-889, JRA-10544)

Please add support in Confluence to turn this header on and off as well
fields.summary: Ability to turn off Precedence Email header in Confluence

Currently if you use a different size for the stylesheet it does not use in some macros like TOC.

Increasing font size for all page and space exports to PDF.

Then use a TOC macro and export, all paragraphs will be altered with the new size, however the toc macro won't.

None

fields.description:
When switching the editor from Rich Text mode to Wiki Markup mode, the wiki markup can be corrupted if Rich Text is the default view. Specifically this happens with multiple levels of bullet points and macros. However, if Wiki Markup is the default view this does not happen. 

h4. Steps to reproduce
# create page
# click Wiki Markup editor
# add a bullet with a macro defining the text color:

fields.description:
Monitor your web browser traffic with Fiddler2 from Microsoft. Install it while your browsers are closed.
Configure it to not hide the image requests. (in the rules menu)
Make sure that your browser uses Fiddler as its proxy. (tools/monitor with Fiddler for FF or tools/fiddler2 for IE)

Open a page
Edit it
Click on EDIT Restrictions (you may need to be admin)
Fiddler shows the missing file image and shows a 404. (see attachment)

All the 404 are alerts that I need to investigate to see where the error comes from.
There should be none.

2.9.3 has these resources
images\icons\view_16.png
images\icons\view_20.png
images\icons\view_20.gif

3.4.3 has these ones
images\icons\view_16-ie6.png
images\icons\view_20.png
images\icons\view_20.gif

So obviously the image cannot be found. As you can see on the attached image, the edit icon is present but not the view one.

Testing for missing resources should be standard.
You could have your testers and developers making sure with Fiddler like I do that no web request results in a 404 or similar error.

fields.description:
This problem only happened in a recently installed instance after restoring a database dump that had (possibly) a different timezone from the running server, so that the table contents got created with a future timestamp, that led to a unexpected behavior on the com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.queue.DatabaseIndexTaskQueue where the '<CONF_HOME>/index/.timestamp' file was created with a date in the future. The consequence was that every time the indexing job ran it couldn't retrieve the new items on the queue to be indexed, resulting in a instance where no content was automatically indexed.
A workaround was re-indexing manually, a definitive solution was correcting the timestamps on the table, removing the '.timestamp' file and restaring the instance.

Some debug info available at: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-3712

h4. Workaround
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+Fails+to+Process+Index+Queue+Automatically
fields.summary: Automatic indexing doesn't work if the creationdate column on the INDEXQUEUEENTRIES table has values in the future

fields.description:
Upgrading Confluence from 3.3 to 3.4.7 fails with:

{code}
2011-01-25 07:49:55,914 INFO [main] [springframework.web.context.ContextLoader] initWebApplicationContext Root WebApplicationContext: initialization completed in 21508 ms
2011-01-25 07:49:58,557 ERROR [main] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute Unsuccessful: alter table EXTRNLNKS add constraint FK97C10FE78DD41734 foreign key (CONTENTID) references CONTENT
2011-01-25 07:49:58,557 ERROR [main] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute ERROR: insert or update on table "extrnlnks" violates foreign key constraint "fk97c10fe78dd41734"
  Detail: Key (contentid)=(1213498) is not present in table "content".
2011-01-25 07:49:58,559 ERROR [main] [hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate] execute could not complete schema update
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: insert or update on table "extrnlnks" violates foreign key constraint "fk97c10fe78dd41734"
  Detail: Key (contentid)=(1213498) is not present in table "content".
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2062)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1795)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:257)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:479)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeWithFlags(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:353)
{code}

h2. Cause

The {{extrnlnks}} table contains stray/outdated entries that reference content in the {{content}} table that does not exist anymore.


h2. Workaround

_The example queries were run against a PostgreSQL database, please adjust them for your particular DBMS_

# Ensure that you have a *backup of the database*!
# Identify the stray link entries, (there should only be a few entires that point to non-existing content):
{code}
SELECT e.linkid, e.contentid, c.contentid, e.url FROM extrnlnks as e LEFT OUTER JOIN content as c ON e.contentid = c.contentid WHERE c.contentid IS NULL
{code}
# Delete the link stray entries 
{code}
DELETE FROM extrnlnks WHERE linkid IN (SELECT e.linkid FROM extrnlnks as e LEFT OUTER JOIN content as c ON e.contentid = c.contentid WHERE c.contentid IS NULL)
{code}
# Restart Confluence to carry on with the upgrade.
fields.summary: Upgrading Confluence fails with "insert or update on table "extrnlnks" violates foreign key constraint"

  {panel}

Confluence usually displays general validation errors at the top of the form, and errors with specific fields near those fields.  This is usually fine.

However:
* in a long form, it may not be obvious that there is a field error somewhere in the form.
* when there is a display bug and the field in error is not displayed at all, or a validation bug where an error is generated for an irrelevant field ([CONF-21692])

I propose displaying a simple message such as "$fieldErrors.size() field-specific error(s) occurred.  Check each field for details."
fields.summary: The Action Error area should mention that there are also Field Errors

fields.description:
There are several ways to configure Confluence so that web-sudo (password-confirmation for admin options) is not available at all.  See [CONF-20958].  In 3.4 (maybe 3.3 too) setting any of these options prevents saving the security configuration.  

When an admin tries to change the security configuration, they are *always* returned to the edit screen, and are given no feedback.

There is a bug in the security config validation where it checks for valid values of the websudo options, even though none are submitted from the form and none are used.  

The worst part of this bug is that the validation is a field error, which would usually be displayed underneath the field with the error.  Since the field is not displayed at all in this case, there is no feedback to the user about the validation problem at all.
fields.summary: Security configuration cannot be updated using custom authenticator or password.confirmation.disabled

fields.description:
Only one draft of a new page can be saved at a time. If you leave open a new page without ever saving, a draft is saved of that new page. If you try to add another page in another window/tab or on another computer, the draft of your first page will be lost and you will not be able to recover you work. It is gone for good. Confluence should be able to manage multiple drafts on new pages.

To reproduce the issue:
Add a new page. Don't save it.
Allow a draft to be saved.
Open a new tab/window.
Add a new page.
Ignore the note that asks if you want to resume/discard.
Enter some information and save the page.
Allow your login to timeout OR close the window tab with the ORIGINAL new page.
View your drafts (User Menu -> Drafts)
There is no draft.
Add a new page.
No message is shown to indicate that you have a draft.
The edits made in your original new page are lost.

For users who switch computers or who work on large NEW pages, this behavior leads to loss of work.
fields.summary: Only a single draft of a new pages is allowed per user - creating another new page deletes earlier draft

  {panel}

We are trying to integrate the crowd with confluence, we are using the Microsoft active directory. we have a user account to connect to the AD. But due to security reasons the id doesn't have the full access to AD like create the groups from the crowd.
Is there any work around like creating the groups manually in AD and accessing them through the crowd and integrate the application. Please let me know any inputs. Thank you.

Regards,
Mohan Kandra.

fields.description:
This is an edge case I found when testing with large numbers of spaces.

1. Create an instance with lots of spaces in it
2. Make sure you do not have any favourite spaces
3. From the dashboard click "Add Page"
4. A dialog will come up to ask what space you want to create the page in. Notice that the drop down is empty, so it is impossible to select a space.
5. Click Next
6. Enjoy your stack trace!

Probably an unlikely edge case, but we should be validating the input.
fields.summary: Adding a new page from the dashboard on an instance with lots of spaces will result in a system error if you do not have any favorite spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21658].
  {panel}

h4.Problem:

Currently the anonymous users can browse and search, if Confluence has anonymous access. However registered users with no "can use" access are welcomed with a "Not Permitted" screen.

If you are a registered user with no "can use" permission you cannot use Confluence, if you logout you are able to see anonymous content.

Allowing the user, whatever the permissions it has, to be able to browse anonymous content would be the feature requested here. 

h4.Goal:

The current goal would allow the registered users not count on license, but allowed to comment, and view pages, while "registered" on a "free account", resuming would be allow ALL users to view anonymous content, logged in or not.

h4.Easy Workaround( to be implemented):

User to be presented with a "go back" to anonymous Browsing once they hit "not permitted" screen.

h4.Fix:

Unfortunately there is none yet.

fields.description:
If a user signs up and uses a space in their user name e.g. "john smith" and then forgets their password and requests a password reset. they cannot reset the password.

They get an error message "user 'john' not found" 

Users should be prevented from using spaces and other white space and non printable characters in their user name.

Changing a user name should also be a heck of a lot easier, this page which outlines the process is a nightmare
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Changing+Usernames

the workaround is for admin to set their password for them.
fields.summary: password reset fails for users with spaces in their user name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21649].
  {panel}

Go to a page with no existing labels
Turn off javascript
Refresh
Click on Add labels link
it does nothing.
Same for edit if you already have labels (and "done" I guess)

Here you could/should use progressive enhancement
- by default show the input fields and submit to edit inside a noscript tag. If JS is present use jQuery to provide something fancier.
- or have non javascript link toggling the edition

Putting labels is some basic function.
We are a governmental user and we have to support non javascript users
